00015 #define HDFS_BUF_SIZE 65536
00016 #define LINE_DEFAULT_SIZE 4096
00017 #define HDFS_BLOCK_SIZE 8388608 //8M
00018 
00019 //====== get File System ======
00020 
00021 hdfsFS getHdfsFS()
00022 {
00023     hdfsFS fs = hdfsConnect("master", 9000);
00024     if (!fs) {
00025         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to connect to HDFS!\n");
00026         exit(-1);
00027     }
00028     return fs;
00029 }
00030 
00031 hdfsFS getlocalFS()
00032 {
00033     hdfsFS lfs = hdfsConnect(NULL, 0);
00034     if (!lfs) {
00035         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to connect to 'local' FS!\n");
00036         exit(-1);
00037     }
00038     return lfs;
00039 }
00040 
00041 //====== get File Handle ======
00042 
00043 hdfsFile getRHandle(const char* path, hdfsFS fs)
00044 {
00045     hdfsFile hdl = hdfsOpenFile(fs, path, O_RDONLY | O_CREAT, 0, 0, 0);
00046     if (!hdl) {
00047         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open %s for reading!\n", path);
00048         exit(-1);
00049     }
00050     return hdl;
00051 }
00052 
00053 hdfsFile getWHandle(const char* path, hdfsFS fs)
00054 {
00055     hdfsFile hdl = hdfsOpenFile(fs, path, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT, 0, 0, 0);
00056     if (!hdl) {
00057         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open %s for writing!\n", path);
00058         exit(-1);
00059     }
00060     return hdl;
00061 }
00062 
00063 hdfsFile getRWHandle(const char* path, hdfsFS fs)
00064 {
00065     hdfsFile hdl = hdfsOpenFile(fs, path, O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0, 0, 0);
00066     if (!hdl) {
00067         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open %s!\n", path);
00068         exit(-1);
00069     }
00070     return hdl;
00071 }
00072 
00073 //====== Read line ======
00074 
00075 //logic:
00076 //buf[] is for batch reading from HDFS file
00077 //line[] is a line buffer, the string length is "length", the buffer size is "size"
00078 //after each readLine(), need to check eof(), if it's true, no line is read due to EOF
00079 struct LineReader {
00080     //static fields
00081     char buf[HDFS_BUF_SIZE];
00082     tSize bufPos;
00083     tSize bufSize;
00084     hdfsFS fs;
00085     hdfsFile handle;
00086     bool fileEnd;
00087 
00088     //dynamic fields
00089     char* line;
00090     int length;
00091     int size;
00092 
00093     LineReader(hdfsFS& fs, hdfsFile& handle)
00094         : bufPos(0)
00095         , length(0)
00096         , size(LINE_DEFAULT_SIZE)
00097     {
00098         this->fs = fs;
00099         this->handle = handle;
00100         fileEnd = false;
00101         fill();
00102         line = (char*)malloc(LINE_DEFAULT_SIZE * sizeof(char));
00103     }
00104 
00105     ~LineReader()
00106     {
00107         free(line);
00108     }
00109 
00110     //internal use only!
00111     void doubleLineBuf()
00112     {
00113         size *= 2;
00114         line = (char*)realloc(line, size * sizeof(char));
00115     }
00116 
00117     //internal use only!
00118     void lineAppend(char* first, int num)
00119     {
00120         while (length + num + 1 > size)
00121             doubleLineBuf();
00122         memcpy(line + length, first, num);
00123         length += num;
00124     }
00125 
00126     //internal use only!
00127     void fill()
00128     {
00129         bufSize = hdfsRead(fs, handle, buf, HDFS_BUF_SIZE);
00130         if (bufSize == -1) {
00131             fprintf(stderr, "Read Failure!\n");
00132             exit(-1);
00133         }
00134         bufPos = 0;
00135         if (bufSize < HDFS_BUF_SIZE)
00136             fileEnd = true;
00137     }
00138 
00139     //user interface
00140     //the line starts at "line", with "length" chars
00141     void readLine()
00142     {
00143         length = 0;
00144         if (bufPos == bufSize)
00145             return;
00146         char* pch = (char*)memchr(buf + bufPos, '\n', bufSize - bufPos);
00147         if (pch == NULL) {
00148             lineAppend(buf + bufPos, bufSize - bufPos);
00149             bufPos = bufSize;
00150             if (!fileEnd)
00151                 fill();
00152             else
00153                 return;
00154             pch = (char*)memchr(buf, '\n', bufSize);
00155             while (pch == NULL) {
00156                 lineAppend(buf, bufSize);
00157                 if (!fileEnd)
00158                     fill();
00159                 else
00160                     return;
00161                 pch = (char*)memchr(buf, '\n', bufSize);
00162             }
00163         }
00164         int validLen = pch - buf - bufPos;
00165         lineAppend(buf + bufPos, validLen);
00166         bufPos += validLen + 1; //+1 to skip '\n'
00167         if (bufPos == bufSize) {
00168             if (!fileEnd)
00169                 fill();
00170             else
00171                 return;
00172         }
00173     }
00174 
00175     char* getLine()
00176     {
00177         line[length] = '\0';
00178         return line;
00179     }
00180 
00181     bool eof()
00182     {
00183         return length == 0 && fileEnd;
00184     }
00185 };
00186 //====== Dir Creation ======
00187 void dirCreate(const char* outdir)
00188 {
00189     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00190     int created = hdfsCreateDirectory(fs, outdir);
00191     if (created == -1) {
00192         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create folder %s!\n", outdir);
00193         exit(-1);
00194     }
00195     hdfsDisconnect(fs);
00196 }
00197 //====== Dir Check ======
00198 int dirCheck(const char* indir, const char* outdir, bool print, bool force) //returns -1 if fail, 0 if succeed
00199 {
00200     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00201     if (hdfsExists(fs, indir) != 0) {
00202         if (print)
00203             fprintf(stderr, "Input path \"%s\" does not exist!\n", indir);
00204         hdfsDisconnect(fs);
00205         return -1;
00206     }
00207     if (hdfsExists(fs, outdir) == 0) {
00208         if (force) {
00209             if (hdfsDelete(fs, outdir) == -1) {
00210                 if (print)
00211                     fprintf(stderr, "Error deleting %s!\n", outdir);
00212                 exit(-1);
00213             }
00214             int created = hdfsCreateDirectory(fs, outdir);
00215             if (created == -1) {
00216                 if (print)
00217                     fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create folder %s!\n", outdir);
00218                 exit(-1);
00219             }
00220         } else {
00221             if (print)
00222                 fprintf(stderr, "Output path \"%s\" already exists!\n", outdir);
00223             hdfsDisconnect(fs);
00224             return -1;
00225         }
00226     } else {
00227         int created = hdfsCreateDirectory(fs, outdir);
00228         if (created == -1) {
00229             if (print)
00230                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create folder %s!\n", outdir);
00231             exit(-1);
00232         }
00233     }
00234     hdfsDisconnect(fs);
00235     return 0;
00236 }
00237 
00238 int dirCheck(vector<string> indirs, const char* outdir, bool print, bool force) //returns -1 if fail, 0 if succeed
00239 {
00240     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00241     for (int i = 0; i < indirs.size(); i++) {
00242         const char* indir = indirs[i].c_str();
00243         if (hdfsExists(fs, indir) != 0) {
00244             if (print)
00245                 fprintf(stderr, "Input path \"%s\" does not exist!\n", indir);
00246             hdfsDisconnect(fs);
00247             return -1;
00248         }
00249     }
00250     if (hdfsExists(fs, outdir) == 0) {
00251         if (force) {
00252             if (hdfsDelete(fs, outdir) == -1) {
00253                 if (print)
00254                     fprintf(stderr, "Error deleting %s!\n", outdir);
00255                 exit(-1);
00256             }
00257             int created = hdfsCreateDirectory(fs, outdir);
00258             if (created == -1) {
00259                 if (print)
00260                     fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create folder %s!\n", outdir);
00261                 exit(-1);
00262             }
00263         } else {
00264             if (print)
00265                 fprintf(stderr, "Output path \"%s\" already exists!\n", outdir);
00266             hdfsDisconnect(fs);
00267             return -1;
00268         }
00269     } else {
00270         int created = hdfsCreateDirectory(fs, outdir);
00271         if (created == -1) {
00272             if (print)
00273                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create folder %s!\n", outdir);
00274             exit(-1);
00275         }
00276     }
00277     hdfsDisconnect(fs);
00278     return 0;
00279 }

00288                 exit(-1);

00290             int created = hdfsCreateDirectory(fs, outdir);
00291             if (created == -1) {
00292                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create folder %s!\n", outdir);
00293                 exit(-1);
00294             }
00295         } else {
00296             fprintf(stderr, "Output path \"%s\" already exists!\n", outdir);
00297             hdfsDisconnect(fs);
00298             return -1;
00299         }
00300     } else {
00301         int created = hdfsCreateDirectory(fs, outdir);
00302         if (created == -1) {
00303             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create folder %s!\n", outdir);

00311 //====== Write line ======
00312 
00313 const char* newLine = "\n";
00314 
00315 struct LineWriter {
00316     hdfsFS fs;
00317     const char* path;
00318     int me; //-1 if there's no concept of machines (like: hadoop fs -put)
00319     int nxtPart;
00320     int curSize;
00321 
00322     hdfsFile curHdl;
00323 
00324     LineWriter(const char* path, hdfsFS fs, int me)
00325         : nxtPart(0)
00326         , curSize(0)
00327     {
00328         this->path = path;
00329         this->fs = fs;
00330         this->me = me;
00331         curHdl = NULL;
00332         //===============================
00333         //if(overwrite==true) readDirForce();
00334         //else readDirCheck();
00335         //===============================
00336         //1. cannot use above, otherwise multiple dir check/delete will be done during parallel writing
00337         //2. before calling the constructor, make sure "path" does not exist
00338         nextHdl();
00339     }
00340 
00341     ~LineWriter()
00342     {
00343         if (hdfsFlush(fs, curHdl)) {
00344             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to 'flush' %s\n", path);
00345             exit(-1);
00346         }
00347         hdfsCloseFile(fs, curHdl);
00348     }
00349 
00350     /*//================== not for parallel writing =====================
00351     //internal use only!
00352     void readDirCheck()
00353 {
00354         if(hdfsExists(fs, path)==0)
00355         {
00356             fprintf(stderr, "%s already exists!\n", path);
00357             exit(-1);
00358         }
00359         int created=hdfsCreateDirectory(fs, path);
00360         if(created==-1)
00361         {
00362             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create folder %s!\n", path);
00363             exit(-1);
00364         }
00365 }
00366 
00367     //internal use only!
00368     void readDirForce()
00369 {
00370         if(hdfsExists(fs, path)==0)
00371         {
00372             if(hdfsDelete(fs, path)==-1)
00373             {
00374                 fprintf(stderr, "Error deleting %s!\n", path);
00375                 exit(-1);
00376             }
00377         }
00378         int created=hdfsCreateDirectory(fs, path);
00379         if(created==-1)
00380         {
00381             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create folder %s!\n", path);
00382             exit(-1);
00383         }
00384 }
00385     */ //================== not for parallel writing =====================
00386 
00387     //internal use only!
00388     void nextHdl()
00389     {
00390         //set fileName
00391         char fname[20];
00392         strcpy(fname, "part_");
00393         char buffer[10];
00394         if (me >= 0) {
00395             sprintf(buffer, "%d", me);
00396             strcat(fname, buffer);
00397             strcat(fname, "_");
00398         }
00399         sprintf(buffer, "%d", nxtPart);
00400         strcat(fname, buffer);
00401         //flush old file
00402         if (nxtPart > 0) {
00403             if (hdfsFlush(fs, curHdl)) {
00404                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to 'flush' %s\n", path);
00405                 exit(-1);
00406             }
00407             hdfsCloseFile(fs, curHdl);
00408         }
00409         //open new file
00410         nxtPart++;
00411         curSize = 0;
00412         char* filePath = new char[strlen(path) + strlen(fname) + 2];
00413         strcpy(filePath, path);
00414         strcat(filePath, "/");
00415         strcat(filePath, fname);
00416         curHdl = getWHandle(filePath, fs);
00417         delete[] filePath;
00418     }
00419 
00420     void writeLine(char* line, int num)
00421     {
00422         if (curSize + num + 1 > HDFS_BLOCK_SIZE) //+1 because of '\n'
00423         {
00424             nextHdl();
00425         }
00426         tSize numWritten = hdfsWrite(fs, curHdl, line, num);
00427         if (numWritten == -1) {
00428             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to write file!\n");
00429             exit(-1);
00430         }
00431         curSize += numWritten;
00432         numWritten = hdfsWrite(fs, curHdl, newLine, 1);
00433         if (numWritten == -1) {
00434             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create a new line!\n");
00435             exit(-1);
00436         }
00437         curSize += 1;
00438     }
00439 };
00440 
00441 //====== Put: local->HDFS ======
00442 
00443 void put(char* localpath, char* hdfspath)
00444 {
00445     if (dirCheck(hdfspath, false) == -1)
00446         return;
00447     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00448     hdfsFS lfs = getlocalFS();
00449 
00450     hdfsFile in = getRHandle(localpath, lfs);
00451     LineReader* reader = new LineReader(lfs, in);
00452     LineWriter* writer = new LineWriter(hdfspath, fs, -1);
00453     while (true) {
00454         reader->readLine();
00455         if (!reader->eof()) {
00456             writer->writeLine(reader->line, reader->length);
00457         } else
00458             break;
00459     }
00460     hdfsCloseFile(lfs, in);
00461     delete reader;
00462     delete writer;
00463 
00464     hdfsDisconnect(lfs);
00465     hdfsDisconnect(fs);
00466 }
00467 
00468 void putf(char* localpath, char* hdfspath) //force put, overwrites target
00469 {
00470     dirCheck(hdfspath, true);
00471     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00472     hdfsFS lfs = getlocalFS();
00473 
00474     hdfsFile in = getRHandle(localpath, lfs);
00475     LineReader* reader = new LineReader(lfs, in);
00476     LineWriter* writer = new LineWriter(hdfspath, fs, -1);
00477     while (true) {
00478         reader->readLine();
00479         if (!reader->eof()) {
00480             writer->writeLine(reader->line, reader->length);
00481         } else
00482             break;
00483     }
00484     hdfsCloseFile(lfs, in);
00485     delete reader;
00486     delete writer;
00487 
00488     hdfsDisconnect(lfs);
00489     hdfsDisconnect(fs);
00490 }
00491 
00492 //====== BufferedWriter ======
00493 struct BufferedWriter {
00494     hdfsFS fs;
00495     const char* path;
00496     int me; //-1 if there's no concept of machines (like: hadoop fs -put)
00497     int nxtPart;
00498     vector<char> buf;
00499     hdfsFile curHdl;
00500 
00501     BufferedWriter(const char* path, hdfsFS fs)
00502     {
00503         this->path = path;
00504         this->fs = fs;
00505         this->me = -1;
00506         this->curHdl = getWHandle(this->path, fs);
00507     }
00508     BufferedWriter(const char* path, hdfsFS fs, int me)
00509         : nxtPart(0)
00510     {
00511         this->path = path;
00512         this->fs = fs;
00513         this->me = me;
00514         curHdl = NULL;
00515         nextHdl();
00516     }
00517 
00518     ~BufferedWriter()
00519     {
00520         tSize numWritten = hdfsWrite(fs, curHdl, &buf[0], buf.size());
00521         if (numWritten == -1) {
00522             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to write file!\n");
00523             exit(-1);
00524         }
00525         buf.clear();
00526 
00527         if (hdfsFlush(fs, curHdl)) {
00528             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to 'flush' %s\n", path);
00529             exit(-1);
00530         }
00531         hdfsCloseFile(fs, curHdl);
00532     }
00533 
00534     //internal use only!
00535     void nextHdl()
00536     {
00537         //set fileName
00538         char fname[20];
00539 
00540         if (me >= 0) {
00541             sprintf(fname, "part_%d_%d", me, nxtPart);
00542         } else {
00543             sprintf(fname, "part_%d", nxtPart);
00544         }
00545 
00546         //flush old file
00547         if (nxtPart > 0) {
00548             if (hdfsFlush(fs, curHdl)) {
00549                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to 'flush' %s\n", path);
00550                 exit(-1);
00551             }
00552             hdfsCloseFile(fs, curHdl);
00553         }
00554         //open new file
00555         nxtPart++;
00556         char* filePath = new char[strlen(path) + strlen(fname) + 2];
00557         sprintf(filePath, "%s/%s", path, fname);
00558         curHdl = getWHandle(filePath, fs);
00559         delete[] filePath;
00560     }
00561 
00562     void check()
00563     {
00564         if (buf.size() >= HDFS_BLOCK_SIZE) {
00565             tSize numWritten = hdfsWrite(fs, curHdl, &buf[0], buf.size());
00566             if (numWritten == -1) {
00567                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to write file!\n");
00568                 exit(-1);
00569             }
00570             buf.clear();
00571             if (me != -1) // -1 means "output in the specified file only"
00572             {
00573                 nextHdl();
00574             }
00575         }
00576     }
00577 
00578     void write(const char* content)
00579     {
00580         int len = strlen(content);
00581         buf.insert(buf.end(), content, content + len);
00582     }
00583 };
00584 
00585 //====== Dispatcher ======
00586 
00587 struct sizedFName {
00588     char* fname;
00589     tOffset size;
00590 
00591     bool operator<(const sizedFName& o) const
00592     {
00593         return size > o.size; //large file goes first
00594     }
00595 };
00596 
00597 struct sizedFString {
00598     string fname;
00599     tOffset size;
00600 
00601     bool operator<(const sizedFString& o) const
00602     {
00603         return size > o.size; //large file goes first
00604     }
00605 };
00606 
00607 const char* rfind(const char* str, char delim)
00608 {
00609     int len = strlen(str);
00610     int pos = 0;
00611     for (int i = len - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
00612         if (str[i] == delim) {
00613             pos = i;
00614             break;
00615         }
00616     }
00617     return str + pos;
00618 }
00619 
00620 vector<string>* dispatchRan(const char* inDir, int numSlaves) //remember to "delete[] assignment" after used
00621 { //locality is not considered for simplicity
00622     vector<string>* assignment = new vector<string>[numSlaves];
00623     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00624     int numFiles;
00625     hdfsFileInfo* fileinfo = hdfsListDirectory(fs, inDir, &numFiles);
00626     if (fileinfo == NULL) {
00627         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to list directory %s!\n", inDir);
00628         exit(-1);
00629     }
00630     tOffset* assigned = new tOffset[numSlaves];
00631     for (int i = 0; i < numSlaves; i++)
00632         assigned[i] = 0;
00633     //sort files by size
00634     vector<sizedFName> sizedfile;
00635     for (int i = 0; i < numFiles; i++) {
00636         if (fileinfo[i].mKind == kObjectKindFile) {
00637             sizedFName cur = { fileinfo[i].mName, fileinfo[i].mSize };
00638             sizedfile.push_back(cur);
00639         }
00640     }
00641     sort(sizedfile.begin(), sizedfile.end());
00642     //allocate files to slaves
00643     vector<sizedFName>::iterator it;
00644     for (it = sizedfile.begin(); it != sizedfile.end(); ++it) {
00645         int min = 0;
00646         tOffset minSize = assigned[0];
00647         for (int j = 1; j < numSlaves; j++) {
00648             if (minSize > assigned[j]) {
00649                 min = j;
00650                 minSize = assigned[j];
00651             }
00652         }
00653         assignment[min].push_back(it->fname);
00654         assigned[min] += it->size;
00655     }
00656     delete[] assigned;
00657     hdfsFreeFileInfo(fileinfo, numFiles);
00658     return assignment;
00659 }
00660 
00661 //considers locality
00662 //1. compute avg size, define it as quota
00663 //2. sort files by size
00664 //3. for each file, if its slave has quota, assign it to the slave
00665 //4. for the rest, run the greedy assignment
00666 //(libhdfs do not have location info, but we can check slaveID from fileName)
00667 //*** NOTE: NOT SUITABLE FOR DATA "PUT" TO HDFS, ONLY FOR DATA PROCESSED BY AT LEAST ONE JOB
00668 vector<string>* dispatchLocality(const char* inDir, int numSlaves) //remember to "delete[] assignment" after used
00669 { //considers locality
00670     vector<string>* assignment = new vector<string>[numSlaves];
00671     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00672     int numFiles;
00673     hdfsFileInfo* fileinfo = hdfsListDirectory(fs, inDir, &numFiles);
00674     if (fileinfo == NULL) {
00675         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to list directory %s!\n", inDir);
00676         exit(-1);
00677     }
00678     tOffset* assigned = new tOffset[numSlaves];
00679     for (int i = 0; i < numSlaves; i++)
00680         assigned[i] = 0;
00681     //sort files by size
00682     vector<sizedFName> sizedfile;
00683     int avg = 0;
00684     for (int i = 0; i < numFiles; i++) {
00685         if (fileinfo[i].mKind == kObjectKindFile) {
00686             sizedFName cur = { fileinfo[i].mName, fileinfo[i].mSize };
00687             sizedfile.push_back(cur);
00688             avg += fileinfo[i].mSize;
00689         }
00690     }
00691     avg /= numSlaves;
00692     sort(sizedfile.begin(), sizedfile.end());
00693     //allocate files to slaves
00694     vector<sizedFName>::iterator it;
00695     vector<sizedFName> recycler;
00696     for (it = sizedfile.begin(); it != sizedfile.end(); ++it) {
00697         istringstream ss(rfind(it->fname, '/'));
00698         string cur;
00699         getline(ss, cur, '_');
00700         getline(ss, cur, '_');
00701         int slaveOfFile = atoi(cur.c_str());
00702         if (assigned[slaveOfFile] + it->size <= avg) {
00703             assignment[slaveOfFile].push_back(it->fname);
00704             assigned[slaveOfFile] += it->size;
00705         } else
00706             recycler.push_back(*it);
00707     }
00708     for (it = recycler.begin(); it != recycler.end(); ++it) {
00709         int min = 0;
00710         tOffset minSize = assigned[0];
00711         for (int j = 1; j < numSlaves; j++) {
00712             if (minSize > assigned[j]) {
00713                 min = j;
00714                 minSize = assigned[j];
00715             }
00716         }
00717         assignment[min].push_back(it->fname);
00718         assigned[min] += it->size;
00719     }
00720     delete[] assigned;
00721     hdfsFreeFileInfo(fileinfo, numFiles);
00722     return assignment;
00723 }
00724 
00725 vector<vector<string> >* dispatchRan(const char* inDir) //remember to delete assignment after used
00726 { //locality is not considered for simplicity
00727     vector<vector<string> >* assignmentPointer = new vector<vector<string> >(_num_workers);
00728     vector<vector<string> >& assignment = *assignmentPointer;
00729     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00730     int numFiles;
00731     hdfsFileInfo* fileinfo = hdfsListDirectory(fs, inDir, &numFiles);
00732     if (fileinfo == NULL) {
00733         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to list directory %s!\n", inDir);
00734         exit(-1);
00735     }
00736     tOffset* assigned = new tOffset[_num_workers];
00737     for (int i = 0; i < _num_workers; i++)
00738         assigned[i] = 0;
00739     //sort files by size
00740     vector<sizedFName> sizedfile;
00741     for (int i = 0; i < numFiles; i++) {
00742         if (fileinfo[i].mKind == kObjectKindFile) {
00743             sizedFName cur = { fileinfo[i].mName, fileinfo[i].mSize };
00744             sizedfile.push_back(cur);
00745         }
00746     }
00747     sort(sizedfile.begin(), sizedfile.end());
00748     //allocate files to slaves
00749     vector<sizedFName>::iterator it;
00750     for (it = sizedfile.begin(); it != sizedfile.end(); ++it) {
00751         int min = 0;
00752         tOffset minSize = assigned[0];
00753         for (int j = 1; j < _num_workers; j++) {
00754             if (minSize > assigned[j]) {
00755                 min = j;
00756                 minSize = assigned[j];
00757             }
00758         }
00759         assignment[min].push_back(it->fname);
00760         assigned[min] += it->size;
00761     }
00762     delete[] assigned;
00763     hdfsFreeFileInfo(fileinfo, numFiles);
00764     return assignmentPointer;
00765 }

00767 vector<vector<string> >* dispatchRan(vector<string> inDirs) //remember to delete assignment after used
00768 { //locality is not considered for simplicity
00769     vector<vector<string> >* assignmentPointer = new vector<vector<string> >(_num_workers);
00770     vector<vector<string> >& assignment = *assignmentPointer;
00771     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00772     vector<sizedFString> sizedfile;
00773     for (int pos = 0; pos < inDirs.size(); pos++) {
00774         const char* inDir = inDirs[pos].c_str();
00775         int numFiles;
00776         hdfsFileInfo* fileinfo = hdfsListDirectory(fs, inDir, &numFiles);
00777         if (fileinfo == NULL) {
00778             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to list directory %s!\n", inDir);
00779             exit(-1);
00780         }
00781         for (int i = 0; i < numFiles; i++) {
00782             if (fileinfo[i].mKind == kObjectKindFile) {
00783                 sizedFString cur = { fileinfo[i].mName, fileinfo[i].mSize };
00784                 sizedfile.push_back(cur);
00785             }
00786         }
00787         hdfsFreeFileInfo(fileinfo, numFiles);
00788     }
00789     //sort files by size
00790     sort(sizedfile.begin(), sizedfile.end());
00791     tOffset* assigned = new tOffset[_num_workers];
00792     for (int i = 0; i < _num_workers; i++)
00793         assigned[i] = 0;
00794     //allocate files to slaves
00795     vector<sizedFString>::iterator it;
00796     for (it = sizedfile.begin(); it != sizedfile.end(); ++it) {
00797         int min = 0;
00798         tOffset minSize = assigned[0];
00799         for (int j = 1; j < _num_workers; j++) {
00800             if (minSize > assigned[j]) {
00801                 min = j;
00802                 minSize = assigned[j];
00803             }
00804         }
00805         assignment[min].push_back(it->fname);
00806         assigned[min] += it->size;
00807     }
00808     delete[] assigned;
00809     return assignmentPointer;
00810 }
00811 
00812 //considers locality
00813 //1. compute avg size, define it as quota
00814 //2. sort files by size
00815 //3. for each file, if its slave has quota, assign it to the slave
00816 //4. for the rest, run the greedy assignment
00817 //(libhdfs do not have location info, but we can check slaveID from fileName)
00818 //*** NOTE: NOT SUITABLE FOR DATA "PUT" TO HDFS, ONLY FOR DATA PROCESSED BY AT LEAST ONE JOB
00819 vector<vector<string> >* dispatchLocality(const char* inDir) //remember to delete assignment after used
00820 { //considers locality
00821     vector<vector<string> >* assignmentPointer = new vector<vector<string> >(_num_workers);
00822     vector<vector<string> >& assignment = *assignmentPointer;
00823     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00824     int numFiles;
00825     hdfsFileInfo* fileinfo = hdfsListDirectory(fs, inDir, &numFiles);
00826     if (fileinfo == NULL) {
00827         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to list directory %s!\n", inDir);
00828         exit(-1);
00829     }
00830     tOffset* assigned = new tOffset[_num_workers];
00831     for (int i = 0; i < _num_workers; i++)
00832         assigned[i] = 0;
00833     //sort files by size
00834     vector<sizedFName> sizedfile;
00835     int avg = 0;
00836     for (int i = 0; i < numFiles; i++) {
00837         if (fileinfo[i].mKind == kObjectKindFile) {
00838             sizedFName cur = { fileinfo[i].mName, fileinfo[i].mSize };
00839             sizedfile.push_back(cur);
00840             avg += fileinfo[i].mSize;
00841         }
00842     }
00843     avg /= _num_workers;
00844     sort(sizedfile.begin(), sizedfile.end());
00845     //allocate files to slaves
00846     vector<sizedFName>::iterator it;
00847     vector<sizedFName> recycler;
00848     for (it = sizedfile.begin(); it != sizedfile.end(); ++it) {
00849         istringstream ss(rfind(it->fname, '/'));
00850         string cur;
00851         getline(ss, cur, '_');
00852         getline(ss, cur, '_');
00853         int slaveOfFile = atoi(cur.c_str());
00854         if (assigned[slaveOfFile] + it->size <= avg) {
00855             assignment[slaveOfFile].push_back(it->fname);
00856             assigned[slaveOfFile] += it->size;
00857         } else
00858             recycler.push_back(*it);
00859     }
00860     for (it = recycler.begin(); it != recycler.end(); ++it) {
00861         int min = 0;
00862         tOffset minSize = assigned[0];
00863         for (int j = 1; j < _num_workers; j++) {
00864             if (minSize > assigned[j]) {
00865                 min = j;
00866                 minSize = assigned[j];
00867             }
00868         }
00869         assignment[min].push_back(it->fname);
00870         assigned[min] += it->size;
00871     }
00872     delete[] assigned;
00873     hdfsFreeFileInfo(fileinfo, numFiles);
00874     return assignmentPointer;
00875 }
00876 
00877 vector<vector<string> >* dispatchLocality(vector<string> inDirs) //remember to delete assignment after used
00878 { //considers locality
00879     vector<vector<string> >* assignmentPointer = new vector<vector<string> >(_num_workers);
00880     vector<vector<string> >& assignment = *assignmentPointer;
00881     hdfsFS fs = getHdfsFS();
00882     vector<sizedFString> sizedfile;
00883     int avg = 0;
00884     for (int pos = 0; pos < inDirs.size(); pos++) {
00885         const char* inDir = inDirs[pos].c_str();
00886         int numFiles;
00887         hdfsFileInfo* fileinfo = hdfsListDirectory(fs, inDir, &numFiles);
00888         if (fileinfo == NULL) {
00889             fprintf(stderr, "Failed to list directory %s!\n", inDir);
00890             exit(-1);
00891         }
00892         for (int i = 0; i < numFiles; i++) {
00893             if (fileinfo[i].mKind == kObjectKindFile) {
00894                 sizedFString cur = { fileinfo[i].mName, fileinfo[i].mSize };
00895                 sizedfile.push_back(cur);
00896                 avg += fileinfo[i].mSize;
00897             }
00898         }
00899         hdfsFreeFileInfo(fileinfo, numFiles);
00900     }
00901     tOffset* assigned = new tOffset[_num_workers];
00902     for (int i = 0; i < _num_workers; i++)
00903         assigned[i] = 0;
00904     //sort files by size
00905     avg /= _num_workers;
00906     sort(sizedfile.begin(), sizedfile.end());
00907     //allocate files to slaves
00908     vector<sizedFString>::iterator it;
00909     vector<sizedFString> recycler;
00910     for (it = sizedfile.begin(); it != sizedfile.end(); ++it) {
00911         istringstream ss(rfind(it->fname.c_str(), '/'));
00912         string cur;
00913         getline(ss, cur, '_');
00914         getline(ss, cur, '_');
00915         int slaveOfFile = atoi(cur.c_str());
00916         if (assigned[slaveOfFile] + it->size <= avg) {
00917             assignment[slaveOfFile].push_back(it->fname);
00918             assigned[slaveOfFile] += it->size;
00919         } else
00920             recycler.push_back(*it);
00921     }
00922     for (it = recycler.begin(); it != recycler.end(); ++it) {
00923         int min = 0;
00924         tOffset minSize = assigned[0];
00925         for (int j = 1; j < _num_workers; j++) {
00926             if (minSize > assigned[j]) {
00927                 min = j;
00928                 minSize = assigned[j];
00929             }
00930         }
00931         assignment[min].push_back(it->fname);
00932         assigned[min] += it->size;
00933     }
00934     delete[] assigned;
00935     return assignmentPointer;
00936 }
00937 
00938 void reportAssignment(vector<string>* assignment, int numSlaves)
00939 {
00940     for (int i = 0; i < numSlaves; i++) {
00941         cout << "====== Rank " << i << " ======" << endl;
00942         vector<string>::iterator it;
00943         for (it = assignment[i].begin(); it != assignment[i].end(); ++it) {
00944             cout << *it << endl;
00945         }
00946     }
00947 }
00948 
00949 void reportAssignment(vector<vector<string> >* assignment)
00950 {
00951     for (int i = 0; i < _num_workers; i++) {
00952         cout << "====== Rank " << i << " ======" << endl;
00953         vector<string>::iterator it;
00954         for (it = (*assignment)[i].begin(); it != (*assignment)[i].end(); ++it) {
00955             cout << *it << endl;
00956         }
00957     }
00958 }
